title: VA Soul Assassins Mixup & Mashup Collection
description:
Music : Hip-Hop / Rap : MP3/Variable


MUGGS PRESENTSÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¦THE SOUL ASSASSINS manages to gather together some of the best names in hip-hop under one umbrella.

Production of the star-studded MUGGS PRESENTSÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¦THE SOUL ASSASSINS began in July 1996. The top notch array of talent on the album reads like a WhoÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s Who of Hip-Hop: Dr. Dre, Cypress HillÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s B-Real, RZA and GZA/Genius from the Wu-Tang Clan, the FugeesÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢ Wyclef (a good friend of MuggÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s whoÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢d done a remix of CypressÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢ ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã…â€œBoom Biddy Bye ByeÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚ï¿½), Goodie Mobb, KRS-One, Mobb Deep, Infamous Mobb, MC Eiht, and LA The Darkman. Understandably, the artistsÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢ conflicting schedules made creating the album an often tricky proposition while the diversity of their styles added to the spontaneity and musical magic of the project.

Working with talented young guns as well as some of the most established MCs in the biz not only allowed Muggs to conjure some bona fide hip-hop magic on tape, the experience personally provided him with a fresh perspective, one which he says will no doubt pay off in dividends on the next Cypress Hill extravaganza.

By maintaining a varied musical diet ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ which includes everything from brooding British trip-hop to seething alternative music ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ Muggs is continually absorbing new sounds and ideas, blending them together, and taking them to the next level of expression. With plenty more dope beats stashed away in the vault until they propel Cypress Hill and the Soul Assassins to even higher plateaus for the next millennium, DJ Muggs is a hip-hop icon who wonÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢t stop rocking until long after he retires.

Share and Enjoy:

DJ SOLO - Open Up The Trunk (Split Tracks)


I just finished my latest mixtape called ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã…â€œOpen Up The TrunkÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚ï¿½ that features new artists (Cool Kids, Pac Div, Dyme Def, Tha Weirdos, U-N-I, The Pack, Play) who are repping for bass-heavy hip-hop, along with a lot of old school beats that inspired their style (Run-DMC, Beastie Boys, NWA, The Clipse, etc). IÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢ve been noticing over the past year or so, a lot of cats who are combining the 80s sound of 808 drum machines and what is considered the commercial sound with a kick and a clap production, dirtying it up and forging the new sound of underground hip-hop. This is nothin but bangin beats for the trunk, real emceein, real DJin and a few exclusives, freestyles, classic DJ SOLO remixes and you even get to hear your boy SOLO rap! DonÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢t sleep.

THE NEW ROYALS (4 SONG MP3) EXCLUSIVE!


The New Royales are a dope up and coming group from Canada/Los Angeles who fuse multiple genres of music into one new defining sound. Produced by Aftermath producer DJ KHALIL, these guys are the illest group youÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢ve never heard of and people such as Dr. Dre, Nas, and Busta Rhymes are already buzzing about them. With upcoming projects featuring Jay Electronica and Chace Infinite of Self Scientific, these guys are sure to leave a mark on todayÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s vacant music landscape. Download the unofficial 4 song sampler exclusively on Soul Assassins dot com. Remember where you heard it first, suckas!!! DonÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢t sleep.

DJ Solo & Roger Jao Present- Jitterbug Driveby (mp3)


One of my homies, Roger Jao, who used to work for Cypress HillÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s marketing company is a big music collector and happens to have a lot of friends who are DJs. He has an extensive catalogue of themed playlists that heÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s compiled, and he hired a group of his DJ friends to mix them as part of an ongoing, downloadable mixtape series. This one here was the one I did called Jitterbug Driveby which features classic swing, jazzy hip-hop, party rock and some official DJ SOLO blends. ItÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s a bangin, feel-good summertime mix

Sick Symphonies vs Funkdoobiest - See The Light (DJ SOLO MASHUP)


A lot of people have been asking me about the Soul Assassins Vs Psycho Realm Mixtape that we have mentioned so IÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢m giving you guys a free MP3 sneak peek and the full story. Originally, this mixtape was supposed to be released along with a limited edition shirt in promotion of the Mask & The Assassin album. Due to some problems, that never happened and the mixtape got shelved for a minute. It exists and IÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢m working on getting it to the people because itÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s dope and I know cats want to hear it. It featured unreleased Psycho Realm tracks, original DJ SOLO remixes and mashups, and lots of classic SA & PR music to get you sick and lifted. This mashup here is from a song off the Terror Tapes and I put it over the Funkdoobiest ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã…â€œBow Wow WowÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚ï¿½ beat on the mixtape. (2003) DJ MUGGS - Soul Assassins Mixtape Vol.1


The sick part about this is the mixtape presented by DJ Muggs and hosted by Chace Infinite. It features an impressively hard hitting collection of beats and rhymes. All in all, you couldnÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢t ask for a better Soul Assassins compilation. The lineup features: Mitchy Slick, Rass Kass w Alchemist, Muggs vs GZA, Self Scientific, Diz Gibran, Eddie Raplife, Expensive Taste, and more. Highlights include the Muggs vs GZA joint, and the homie Diz GibranÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s banger donÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢t sleep on the banger ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã…â€œThe City (LA).ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚ï¿½ 14 tracks deep.ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚ï¿½

DJ Solo Classics and Exclusives




DJ SOLO - SOUL ASSASSINS Classic & Exclusive
In case you never had the opportunity to see us at at a show where we were either selling or giving away our mixtapes, we are now posting them one by one for FREE download! This one is the Classic & Exclusive Soul Assassins mix I did in 2006 (as seen in The Source) right when I first started working here at Soul Assassins/Angeles Records. I did this before I had Serato so it was all done with actual vinyl and a few CDs, suck on that, microwave DJs!! Obviously IÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢m critical of my own work and itÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s not, in my opinion, my best, up to date, skill level of mixtape making, but it is a real dope mix that you can play in your car or bump at the house when youÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢re chillin. ItÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s full of all the classic Soul Assassins songs a lot of us grew up on, including an unrelesed Cypress Hill track that Muggs dug out from his archives, an exclusive Sick Symphonies freestyle that Jack and Cynic did for me, a few original DJ SOLO mashup mixes that were really the origins of my mashup style that you hear today, and itÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s all hosted by DJ Muggs himself. Included in the download is the front and back cover art, and donÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢t forget that itÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s a mixtape, so if you burn it to a CD, make sure you put ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã…â€œ0ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â³ seconds between the tracks or youÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢ll have gaps. Otherwise, just drag it into your iTunes and youÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢re ready to ride and smoke! Enjoy.
